div1.p: Abner S Nancy vs Capt Wm Matthews}SS
Aplication for Writ of Habeas Corpus

To the honorable E.P. Oliphant judge of the 1st judicial district of W T. your petitioner Abner S Nancy complains of the defendent Capt Wm Matthews and alleges he is unlawfully restrianed of this his liberty the defendant at or near Lewiston WT the pretense of the restraint is an enlistment in the service of the USA 1st Oregon Cavarly and your petitioner further avers that he was enlisted at Oakland oregon Daylop County Oregon on the 23rd day of February 1869 and your petitioner at that time was but seventeen years old and was enlisted without the consent of his parents your petitioner further says that when he enlisted he had the posession of the thrity one dollars per month no portion of which had been paid which leaves your petitioner extremely destitute your petitioner avers that when he enlisted the the service he had a horse and yet has him which he pray he may have liberty with being when Wherefore your petitioner prays a writ of Habeas Corpus may issue and that your petitioner may be discharged of the illegal restraint
Abner S Nancy first being duly sworn says the matters and things stated in the foregoing complaint are true of his own knowledge Subscribed and sworn to this 29th day of July A.D.,1862
